title: Top NFL Draft prospect Fernando Mendoza enthralled by possibility of Tom Brady mentorship: ‘It would mean so much’
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Fernando Mendoza, the projected No. 1 NFL Draft pick, is excited about potential mentorship from Tom Brady with the Las Vegas Raiders.
Mendoza, 22, led Indiana to a national championship, winning the Heisman Trophy and achieving notable passing stats last season.
While experts predict Mendoza will join the Raiders, he remains open-minded, stating any draft outcome is possible.

title: 5 must-watch movies & TV shows streaming right now
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: Jennifer Lopez stars in 'Kiss of the Spider Woman,' streaming on Hulu, based on the Tony Award-winning musical.
Morgan Neville's documentary 'Paul McCartney: Man on the Run' is available on Prime Video, detailing the musician's post-Beatles career.
Season 4 of 'Bridgerton' focuses on Benedict Bridgerton and is now streaming on Netflix, featuring a Cinderella-like storyline.

title: Red Sox’ Roman Anthony and Ceddanne Rafaela say they’re fine after outfield collision
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Red Sox' Roman Anthony and Ceddanne Rafaela collided during a spring training game against the Braves but avoided major injury.
Both Anthony and Rafaela stayed in the game after the collision, each recording hits against former teammate Chris Sale.
Manager Alex Cora attributed the collision to miscommunication, but both players assured they were not seriously hurt.

title: Alex Cora to donate $20K to Jimmy Fund when 2026 Red Sox hit this milestone
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Alex Cora pledges $20,000 to the Jimmy Fund when a 2026 Red Sox player hits 20 home runs.
The Jimmy Fund benefits cancer care and research at Boston's Dana-Farber Cancer Institute.
Cora's donation would be his largest public contribution to the Jimmy Fund, surpassing past donations linked to team performance.

title: N.H. House advances bill targeting ‘indoctrination’ in public schools
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: The New Hampshire House passed the CHARLIE Act, banning specific teachings on race and LGBTQ+ issues in public schools.
The bill prohibits teaching that frames events as divisive conflicts or promotes certain political ideologies, allowing lawsuits for violations.
Critical race theory and intersectionality discussions are limited to Marxian critiques opposing American tradition, law, and ethics.

title: The story behind these colorful icicles in the Berkshires
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: Colorful icicles on Route 2 in North Adams are created using food coloring and water balloons.
This vibrant icicle tradition in the Berkshires has been ongoing for decades, involving local community participation.
The iconic Hairpin Turn offers views of Hoosac Valley and Mount Greylock, and hosts The Golden Eagle Restaurant.

title: Mass. reports first two measles cases of 2026, including one in Greater Boston
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Massachusetts confirms first two measles cases of 2026: a Greater Boston adult and a school-aged child.
The child was exposed out-of-state and posed no exposure risk in Massachusetts, health officials reported.
The Greater Boston case involves an adult with uncertain vaccination history who traveled abroad recently.

title: Local obituary: Morgan Mallard-Vitiello, 33, lifelong South Boston resident and mother of 2
author: Boston.com Staff
bullets: Morgan Mallard-Vitiello, 33, of South Boston, passed away on February 21, 2026, after a brief illness at Brigham and Women's Hospital.
Morgan was a lifelong resident of South Boston, known for her work with City of Boston Inspectional Services and a Dunkin’ Donuts commercial.
She is survived by her husband Francis Vitiello, children Mya and Frankie, and her parents Susan Kenneally and Bryan Van Dorpe.

title: She’s running Boston for The ALS Association in memory of her dad
author: Autumn Sloboda
bullets: Lauren Hamilton, 26, from Tampa, will run the 2026 Boston Marathon in memory of her father.
Her father, who worked in Boston as a salesman, passed away from ALS when she was 25.
Hamilton aims to raise awareness and hope for ALS treatment as she runs the marathon.

title: DiZoglio files emergency motion after AG Campbell moves to strike down audit lawsuit
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: State Auditor Diana DiZoglio filed an emergency motion after AG Andrea Campbell moved to strike her audit lawsuit.
DiZoglio is attempting to audit the state Legislature, backed by a 72% voter-approved ballot measure asserting her authority.
AG Campbell argues DiZoglio lacks authority for the lawsuit and has not adequately answered questions about the audit.
